Author: Lu Xun
Quote: I thought: hope cannot be said to exist, nor can it be said not to exist. It is just like roads across the earth. For actually the earth had no roads to begin with, but when many men pass one way, a road is made.

Author: Bobby Orr
Quote: Growing up in Canada, most kids from Canada dream of playing in the NHL, and they also hope one day to be on a Stanley Cup team. That was a big goal.

Author: Haruki Murakami,  1Q84
Quote: Wherever there's hope there's a trial.

Author: E.E. Cummings,  100 Selected Poems
Quote: Always it’s Spring)and everyone’s in love and flowers pick themselves.

Author: tayeb saleh,  Season of Migration to the North
Quote: Now I'm making a decision. I choose life. I shall live because there are few people I want to stay with for the longest possible time and because I have duties to discharge. It is not my concern whether or not life has meaning. If I am unable to forgive, then I shall try to forget. I shall live by force and cunning."­

Author: Tana French,  The Likeness
Quote: Time works so hard for us, if only we can let it.

Author: Sandra Cisneros
Quote: In English, my name means hope. In Spanish, it means too many letters. It means sadness. It means waiting. It is like the number nine, a muddy color.

Author: Henrik Edberg,  The 7 Timeless Habits of Happiness
Quote: If you see the world and yourself through a lens smudged by negativity then you’ll find much misery. If you look outwards and inwards through lens brightened by positivity you’ll find much to be happy and appreciative about.

Author: Robert M. Drake
Quote: Its dark and I’m reading my scars because our moments remind me of where I should be.

Author: Kate Morgenroth,  Jude
Quote: You can break a man with hope.

Author: Shushiki,  Japanese Haiku
Quote: Dead my old fine hopesAnd dry my dreaming but still...Iris, blue each spring

Author: C.S. Lewis
Quote: Here the whole world (stars, water, air,And field, and forest, as they wereReflected in a single mind)Like cast off clothes was left behindIn ashes, yet with hopes that she,Re-born from holy poverty,In lenten lands, hereafter mayResume them on her Easter Day."(Epitaph for Joy Davidman)

Author: Anne Fortier,  Juliet
Quote: There is a trick to flying. The angels told me."He had smiled at my wide-eyed awe. "You need to forget everything you know as a human being. When you are human, you discover that there is great power in hating the earth. And it can almost make you fly. But it never will."I had frowned, not quite understanding him. "So, what's the trick?""Love the sky.

Author: Desmond Tutu
Quote: Your ordinary acts of love and hope point to the extraordinary promise that every human life is of inestimable value.

Author: Octavia Spencer
Quote: I hope that in some way that I can be some sort of beacon of hope, especially because I am not the typical Hollywood beauty.

Author: Daniel Wallace,  The Kings and Queens of Roam
Quote: He believed in himself, believed in his quixotic ambition, letting the failures of the previous day disappear as each new day dawned. Yesterday was not today. The past did not predict the future if he could learn from his mistakes.

Author: Robert M. Drake
Quote: You’re not a bad person, you’re just a little bit different and I’m a sucker for that.

Author: Jonathan Edwards,  The Religious Affections
Quote: A truly Christian love, either to God or men, is a humble broken-hearted love. The desires of the saints, however earnest, are humble desires. Their hope is a humble hope; and their joy, even when it is unspeakable and full of glory, is a humble broken-hearted joy, and leaves the Christian more poor in spirit, and more like a little child, and more disposed to a universal lowliness of behaviour.

Author: Ray Lamontagne
Quote: But everything I have to give, I'll give to you

Author: Muriel Barbery,  The Elegance of the Hedgehog
Quote: We can be friends. We can be anything we want to be.

Author: Matthew Bellamy
Quote: I want to reconcile the violence in your heart.I want to recognize your beauty's not just a mask.I want to exorcise the demons from your past.I want to satisfy the undisclosed desires in your heart.

Author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
Quote: For what it's worth: it's never too late to be whoever you want to be. I hope you live a life you're proud of, and if you find you're not, I hope you have the strength to start over again.

Author: Chris Fabry,  Almost Heaven
Quote: Because I don't think God trusts just anybody with so much heartache. The world has not yet seen what God can do with a man who gives both halves of a broken heart to him. And I don't doubt that a man like that can change the world...or at least a little part of it.

Author: Martin Luther King Jr.,  The Autobiography of Martin Luther King, Jr.
Quote: In some not too distant tomorrow the radiant stars of love and brotherhood will shine over our great nation with all their scintillating beauty.

Author: Robert M. Drake
Quote: Maybe love was meant to save us from ourselves.

Author: Carolyn Turgeon,  Godmother: The Secret Cinderella Story
Quote: Tous mes anciens amours vont me revenir.'- All my old loves will be returned to me

Author: Victor Hugo,  The Toilers of the Sea
Quote: In joined hands there is still some token of hope, in the clinched fist none.

Author: Nathanael West,  The Day of the Locust
Quote: Only those who still have hope can benefit from tears.

Author: Cressida Cowell,  How to Twist a Dragon's Tale
Quote: And now that its ruby eyes are set into the gold, you cannot see their tear-shape, so they seem to be laughing rather than crying. It is a constant reminder to me of the human ability to create something beautiful even when things are at the darkest.

Author: Melina Marchetta,  Finnikin of the Rock
Quote: He hesitated, remembering something Finnikin had said to him on their journey. That somehow, even in the worst of times, the tiniest fragments of good survive. It was the grip in which one held those fragments that counted.

Author: Thomas à Kempis,  The Inner Life
Quote: In the Cross is salvation; in the Cross is life; in the Cross is protection against our enemies; in the Cross is infusion of heavenly sweetness; in the Cross is strength of mind; in the Cross is joy of spirit; in the Cross is excellence of virtue; in the Cross is perfection of holiness. There is no salvation of soul, nor hope of eternal life, save in the Cross.

Author: Eugene Cernan
Quote: As we leave the Moon at Taurus-Littrow, we leave as we came, and God willing, as we shall return, with peace and hope for all mankind.

Author: Amaka Imani Nkosazana
Quote: People will always notice something about you. It might be the way you walk or the way you talk, or just simply your personality. Live each day in the way you want to be remembered. Live in such a way that people will be inspired by those unique qualities that you have and strive to live better lives for themselves.

Author: Jerome Groopman
Quote: To hope under the most extreme circumstances is an act of defiance that permits a person to live his life on his own terms. It is part of the human spirit to endure and give a miracle a chance to happen.

Author: Jennifer Elisabeth,  Born Ready: Unleash Your Inner Dream Girl
Quote: I really believe that there is an invisible red thread tied between him and me, and that it has stretched and tangled for years — across oceans and lifetimes. I know that it won’t break because our souls are tied.

Author: Benjamin Alire Sáenz,  Last Night I Sang to the Monster
Quote: Summertime. It was a song. It was a season. I wondered if that season would ever live inside of me.

Author: Michael Flynn,  Eifelheim
Quote: Any fool can hope when success lies plainly in view. It wants genuine strength to hope when matters are hopeless.

Author: Mark Strand,  The Late Hour
Quote: The Coming of LightEven this late it happens:the coming of love, the coming of light. You wake and the candles are lit as if by themselves, stars gather, dreams pour into your pillows, sending up warm bouquets of air.Even this late the bones of the body shine and tomorrow’s dust flares into breath.

Author: Pope Benedict XVI
Quote: One who has hope lives differently.

Author: Christine de Pizan,  Ditié de Jehanne d'Arc
Quote: [W]hen someone finds himself quite unjustly attacked and hated on all sides, there is no need for such a person to feel dismayed by misfortune. See how Fortune, who has harmed many a one, is so inconstant, for God, Who opposes all wrong deeds, raises up those in whom hope dwells.

Author: Vaclav Havel
Quote: Hope is a state of mind, not of the world. Hope, in this deep and powerful sense, is not the same as joy that things are going well, or willingness to invest in enterprises that are obviously heading for success, but rather an ability to work for something because it is good.

Author: Quentin Blake
Quote: With my pictures, what I hope is that it encourages the reader to imagine more pictures of his own.

Author: Christina Rossetti
Quote: Fair as the moon and joyful as the light;Tot wan with waiting, not with sorrow dim; Not as she is, but was when hope shone bright;Not as she is, but as she fills his dreams.

Author: Margaret Atwood,  The Handmaid's Tale
Quote: One of the gravestones in the cemetery near the earliest church has an anchor on it and an hourglass, and the words In Hope.In Hope. Why did they put that above a dead person? Was it the corpse hoping, or those still alive?

Author: Abraham Lincoln
Quote: The mystic chords of memory, stretching from every battle-field, and patriot grave, to every living heart and hearth-stone, all over this broad land, will yet swell the chorus of the Union, when again touched, as surely they will be, by the better angels of our nature.--as quoted in THE RIVER OF WINGED DREAMS

Author: Bob Sorge,  Glory: When Heaven Invades Earth
Quote: The nature of the enemy's warfare in your life is to cause you to become discouraged and to cast away your confidence. Not that you would necessarily discard your salvation, but you could give up your hope of God's deliverance. The enemy wants to numb you into a coping kind of Christianity that has given up hope of seeing God's resurrection power.

Author: J.R.R. Tolkien,  The Two Towers
Quote: Being a cheerful hobbit, he had not needed hope, as long as despair could be postponed.

Author: Robert M. Drake
Quote: I know how you feel because I’ve been there too. I’ve hated and I’ve loved. I’ve seen my demons root and crawl and my angels branch and soar. I've died within myself and lived a thousand different lives. I too fight the same war and I too am drowning in the puddles of self-consciousness this world created.

Author: William Peter Blatty,  The Exorcist
Quote: We mourn the blossoms of May because they are to whither; but we know that May is one day to have its revenge upon November, by the revolution of that solemn circle which never stops---which teaches us in our height of hope, ever to be sober, and in our depth of desolation, never to despair.

Author: Sharon Kay Penman,  The Reckoning
Quote: I’ll admit that my garden now grows hope in lavish profusion, leaving little room for anything else. I suppose it has squeezed out more practical plants like caution and common sense. Still, though, hope does not flourish in every garden, and I feel thankful it has taken root in mine.

Author: Jennifer Elisabeth
Quote: I met a boy whose eyes showed me that the past, present and future were all the same thing.

Author: Lorna Byrne,  Angels In My Hair
Quote: Your guardian angel never, ever stops communicating with you.  I feel that at times they should be frustrated with us but they seem to have endless patience and they never ever give up on us.

Author: Jonathan Brandis
Quote: However, I hope I am also judged on my accomplishments as an actor and not just on my pretty face!

Author: Machado de Assis
Quote: O Diabo, invejoso, fez o homem confundir fé com religião e amor com casamento.

Author: Elie Wiesel,  Open Heart
Quote: I still believe in man in spite of man. I believe in language even though it has been wounded, deformed, and perverted by the enemies of mankind. And I continue to cling to words because it is up to us to transform them into instruments of comprehension rather than contempt. It is up to us to choose whether we wish to use them to curse or to heal, to wound or to console.

Author: Criss Jami,  Killosophy
Quote: Easily mistaken, it is not about a love for adversity, it is about knowing a strength and a faith so great that adversity, in all its adverse manifestations, hardly even exists.

Author: Simon Tugwell
Quote: We must be content to grow slowly. Most of us will still barely be at the beginning of our recovery by the time we die. But that is better than killing ourselves pretending to be healthy.

Author: Toba Beta,  My Ancestor Was an Ancient Astronaut
Quote: I don't buy idea of second chance.With hope we make a lot of chances.

Author: Sarah Addison Allen
Quote: Stability was overrated. Crises and adventures, on the other hand, could actually teach you something.

Author: John Hepworth
Quote: God, there must be a meaning. Fiercely he was certain that there must be a meaning.Surely, while we live we are not lost.Oh Janos, Janos my brother!Surely we are not lost--while we live.

Author: Henryk Sienkiewicz,  In Desert and Wilderness
Quote: Nevertheless, in this sea of human wretchedness and malice there bloomed at times compassion, as a pale flower blooms in a putrid marsh.

Author: Jennifer Elisabeth
Quote: I could watch him do this until morning — never asking questions and never interrupting his work. I worship quietly — his intense focus and attention to detail and then, out of no where, I realize the inconvenient, inappropriate truth: ‘I love this man… and it has swallowed me.

Author: N.T. Wright,  Surprised by Hope: Rethinking Heaven, the Resurrection, and the Mission of the Church
Quote: What we have at the moment isn't as the old liturgies used to say, 'the sure and certain hope of the resurrection of the dead,' but a vague and fuzzy optimism that somehow things may work out in the end.

Author: Charlie Rae
Quote: False hope is a terrible thing, if its the only thing keeping you alive you'll be dead by dawn.

Author: Tad Williams,  Shadowplay
Quote: You are only a prisoner when you surrender.

Author: Ruta Sepetys,  Between Shades of Gray
Quote: I felt as if I were riding a pendulum. Just as I would swing into the abyss of hopelessness, the pendulum would swing back with some small goodness.

Author: Suzanne Collins,  Gregor and the Code of Claw
Quote: If you had hope, maybe you could find a way to make things change,. Because if you thought about it, there were so many reasons to try.

Author: Kim Yuna
Quote: Peace is what enables development and is critical in providing opportunities to young people. Efforts to preserve peace are absolutely vital in bringing prosperity and hope for the future.

Author: Hany Adeeb
Quote: لا تستهين بنفسك ، حتى لو كنت قطرة ، محاولاتك المستمرة .. بصبر تستطيع أن تفتت الصخر

Author: Orson Scott Card,  Ender's Game
Quote: I have hope for you, if only because you're the only one left to hope for.

Author: Aberjhani,  I Made My Boy Out of Poetry
Quote: Just above our terror, the stars painted this storyin perfect silver calligraphy. And our souls, too oftenabused by ignorance, covered our eyes with mercy.

Author: J.R.R. Tolkien,  The Return of the King
Quote: I do not know what is happening. The reason of my waking mind tells me that great evil has befallen and we stand at the end of days. But my heart says nay; and all my limbs are light, and a hope and joy are come to me that no reason can deny. [...] I do not believe that darkness will endure!

Author: Magith Noohukhan
Quote: Never loose hope. Stay strong, you never know what tomorrow brings.

Author: Hannah Senesh
Quote: To die,so young to die.No, no, not I,I love the warm sunny skies,light, song, shining eyes,I want no war, no battle cry,No, no, not I.

Author: Jonas Salk
Quote: There is hope in dreams, imagination, and in the courage of those who wish to make those dreams a reality.

Author: Joyce Carol Oates,  Faithless: Tales of Transgression
Quote: A mouth of no distinction but well practiced, before I entered my teens, in irony. For what is irony but the repository of hurt? And what is hurt but the repository of hope?

Author: Dejan Stojanovic,  The Sun Watches the Sun
Quote: Hope without love is hopeless.

Author: Jane Yolen
Quote: Part of her revolted against the insanity of the rules. Part of her was grateful. In a world of chaos, any guidelines helped. And she knew that each day she remained alive, she remained alive. One plus one plus one. The Devil's arithmetic...

Author: Charles Du Bos
Quote: Joy is but the sign that creative emotion is fulfilling its purpose.

Author: Jennifer Elisabeth
Quote: I know that your soul is on life support and that you feel lost and like you’re completely spinning out of control, but you’re finding yourself — here, tonight… even in this darkness.

Author: Cassandra Clare,  City of Lost Souls
Quote: It is stupid to hope, but sometimes hope is all you have.

Author: Gaston Caperton
Quote: It is our hope that the AP program can serve as an anchor for increasing rigor in our schools. Rigor can be maintained while increasing student participation.

Author: Angel Wagenstein,  Isaac's Torah
Quote: The fruit of empty hopes is more bitter than the saddest truth.

Author: Richelle E. Goodrich,  Smile Anyway: Quotes, Verse, & Grumblings for Every Day of the Year
Quote: Life isn't all grand, but it isn't all miserable either. There's both sweet and sour in every day. So why focus on the ugly when you can gaze at what's beautiful? Concentrate on the good.

Author: Kahlil Gibran
Quote: Behind the veil of each night, there is a smiling dawn.

Author: R.N. Prasher
Quote: The restless spirit never loses its wings. If sometimes it cannot fly, it is because during those moments the sky vanishes.

Author: Scott O'Dell,  Island of the Blue Dolphins
Quote: Below me Rontu was running along the cliffs barking at the screaming gulls. Pelicans were chattering as they finished the blue water. But suddenly I thought of Tutok, and the island seemed very quiet.

Author: Mark Evans
Quote: God can inject hope into a absolutely hopeless situation.

Author: Sri Chinmoy,  My Life's Soul-Journey: Daily Meditations for Ever-Increasing Spiritual Fulfillment
Quote: Hope is sweet.Hope is illumining.Hope is fulfilling.Hope can be everlasting.Therefore, do not give up hope,Even in the sunset of your life.

Author: Suzanne Collins,  Gregor the Overlander
Quote: Even if times got bad, he would never again deny himself the possibility that the future might be happy even if the present was painful. He would allow himself dreams.

Author: Jane Austen,  Sense and Sensibility
Quote: …told herself likewise not to hope. But it was too late. Hope had already entered…

Author: Albert Camus,  The Plague
Quote: And indeed it could be said that once the faintest stirring of hope became possible, the dominion of plague was ended.

Author: Robert M. Drake
Quote: I need you because I know I deserve you but let me fall in love with you one last time before I let go. So I can remember the beautiful imperfection that rattled my bones.

Author: Tabitha Suzuma,  A Note of Madness
Quote: But whichever form it took it brought with it, in those moments of bitter anguish, such a desperate surge of hope that it was almost untouchable, and flitted away like a golden butterfly into the bright blue sky - beautiful, unreachable and completely transistent.

Author: Jennifer DeLucy
Quote: Why wait? So precious is this life—this gift—this temporary blindness. Burn and drown and embrace the false dark, then grasp the unthinkable height of resulting joy. For in the end, in the light of truth when the flesh is cast off, there is nothing but this.

Author: Richelle E. Goodrich,  Eena, The Return of a Queen
Quote: Don’t simply exist in this world, but grasp life’s potential by the jacket. Dare it to be all it can. Make life historical—a gripping account of accomplishment. Make life a mystery—a challenging, bold adventure. Make life heartfelt—an enduring, poetic romance. Whatever it is you make of your world, live the fairytale.

Author: Don Baylor
Quote: I'm going to try to enjoy the All-Star break, hope my players reflect on what happened the first half of the season, come back with a different attitude, try to find our solution on how to win it.

Author: Louis-Ferdinand Céline,  North
Quote: Life must go on, even if it's no joke...just pretend to believe in the future.

Author: Shinobu Ohtaka
Quote: Destiny isn't something you make as you're told. By overcoming difficulties, life and this whole world can advance forward. That's what destiny is for. A world that has lost the power to advance forward, will be destroyed - Aladdin

Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
Quote: Belief consists in accepting the affirmations of the soul; unbelief, in denying them.

Author: Richelle E. Goodrich,  Dandelions: The Disappearance of Annabelle Fancher
Quote: In a world plagued with commonplace tragedies, only one thing exists that truly has the power to save lives, and that is love.

Author: Anosh Irani,  The Cripple and His Talismans
Quote: A loss of any kind is horrible. Not because it takes away, but because it makes you believe- in newspapers, in tomatoes, in empty whiskey bottles.

Author: John Green
Quote: I believe in hope, in what is something called ”radical hope.” I believe there is hope for all of us, even amid the suffering. And that’s why I write fiction, probaby. It’s my attempt to keep that fragile strand of radical hope, to buld a fire in the darkness.r

Author: Rebecca West
Quote: The world is round and the place which may seem like the end may also be only the beginning.

Author: Patrick Curry,  Defending Middle-Earth: Tolkien: Myth and Modernity
Quote: Despair is for people who know, beyond any doubt, what the future is going to bring. Nobody is in that position. So despair is not only a kind of sin, theologically, but also a simple mistake, because nobody actually knows. In that sense there is always hope.

Author: Aberjhani,  Elemental: The Power of Illuminated Love
Quote: And now we step to the rhythm of miracles.--from The Light, That Never Dies

Author: Landon Parham,  First Night of Summer
Quote: All things, even the deepest sorrow or the most profound happiness are all temporary. Hope is fuel for the soul, without hope, forward motion ceases.

Author: Harley King
Quote: Sometimes thatwhich we fearstrengthens ourspirit and givesus a splashof hope.

Author: Melodie Ramone
Quote: I'm pretty much looking for beauty all the time. It just seems like some days the light is better to see it.

Author: Kaya McLaren,  How I Came to Sparkle Again
Quote: Miracles were just second chances if you really thought about it--second chances when all hope was lost.

Author: Cecelia Ahern,  The Book of Tomorrow
Quote: Two lost things that had survived the seas and arrived on a coastline. What did they do? They implanted themselves in the sand and grew into trees and lined the beaches. Sometimes a lot can come of being all washed up. You can really grow.

Author: Alfred de Vigny,  Stello
Quote: Hope is the greatest madness. What can we expect of a world that we enter with the assurance of seeing our fathers and mothers die? A world where, if two beings love each other and give their lives to each other, both can be sure that one will watch the other perish?

Author: Robert M. Drake
Quote: How could I live above the water or breathe under it. How could I swim in darkness consumed in an ocean of you? Falling or flying towards you, losing or finding myself in you and beauty was never the word to catch all that you are. For now I know the means of the infinite and it all starts and ends with you.

Author: Jodi Picoult,  Lone Wolf
Quote: Hope and reality lie in inverse proportions, inside the walls of a hospital... Doubt is like dye. Once is spreads into the fabric of excuses you've woven, you'll never get rid of the stain.

Author: Toni Sorenson
Quote: I challenge you to make your life the masterpiece you want to paint, the novel you want to read, the day you want to wake to.

Author: Robert M. Drake
Quote: At the end of the day I went to this place where your memories left footsteps on my skin and the breath of your touch stained my desire. Yea, it was one of those nights where I needed you the most.

Author: Robert Uttaro,  To the Survivors
Quote: But no matter how much evil I see, I think it’s important for everyone to understand that there is much more light than darkness.

Author: Catherynne M. Valente,  The Girl Who Circumnavigated Fairyland in a Ship of Her Own Making
Quote: Where there is a Key, there is yet hope.

Author: Aberjhani,  The River of Winged Dreams
Quote: Feet sandaled with dreams tread paths of vision leading to wisdom’s sharp peaks.

Author: Fyodor Dostoyevsky,  The Brothers Karamazov
Quote: Do you think it is a vain hope that one day man will find joy in noble deeds of light and mercy, rather than in the coarse pleasures he indulges in today -- gluttony, fornication, ostentation, boasting, and envious vying with his neighbor? I am certain this is not a vain hope and that the day will come soon.

Author: Tobias Wolff,  Old School
Quote: The beauty of a fragment is that it still supports the hope of brilliant completeness.

Author: Sherrilyn Kenyon,  Retribution
Quote: For our people, butterflies are a symbol of hope. It's said that if you capture one in your hands and whisper your dreams to it, it will carry them up to the heavens so that the wish can be granted.

Author: Aberjhani,  Journey through the Power of the Rainbow: Quotations from a Life Made Out of Poetry
Quote: In honor of Oprah Winfrey: Even greater than the ability to inspire others with hope is the power to motivate them to give as much to the lives of others as they would give to their own; and to empower them to confront the worst in themselves in order to discover and claim the best in themselves.

Author: Elbert Hubbard
Quote: Love, we say, is life; but love without hope and faith is agonizing death.

Author: Criss Jami,  Killosophy
Quote: I am thankful when I am hungry because then I know that when I eat, the food will taste better. Life has taught me that my true contentment rests in hope, and the pleasure itself is secondary. It is self-awareness, not happiness, that maintains peace.

Author: Elizabeth George Speare,  Calico Captive
Quote: I have no word of yours to assure me that our brief friendship held for you the same significance it held for me, but I must go on believing so. Every hope of the future is meaningless unless I have faith that you and I will share it together.

Author: Temitope Owosela
Quote: Hope and faith goes hand-in-hand, because without hope there is no faith. The same goes with want and needs, without any wants, there no need to have a need

Author: Jarod Kintz,  A Zebra is the Piano of the Animal Kingdom
Quote: When I’m feeling down, I make myself a big bowl of Up Soup. The bowl only looks empty, but in reality it’s full of hope. Grab a spoon, there’s plenty for both of us.

Author: Robert Ludlum,  The Bourne Supremacy
Quote: The cruelest thing you can do to a person who's living in panic is to offer him or her hope that turns out false. When the crash comes its intolerable.

Author: Lloyd Alexander,  The Black Cauldron
Quote: He will not succeed in this,"Taran said. "Somehow, we must find a way to escape. We dare not lose hope.""I agree absolutely,"Fflewddur answered. "Your general idea is excellent; it's only the details that are lacking...

Author: Robert Louis Stevenson
Quote: To travel hopefully is better than to have arrived.

Author: Hasil Paudyal,  Blended Words
Quote: May be its mine bad-luck Or yours not to get me But I still have hope Of being yours

Author: V.S. Atbay
Quote: All beautiful distractions, ignites from you.

Author: The Calling
Quote: I know now, just quite howMy life and love might still go onIn your heart, in your mindI'll stay with you for all of time.

Author: Bernard Kelvin Clive,  Your Dreams Will Not Die
Quote: I’ve learned that no matter how inspired, fired up and motivated you might be, the dark clouds will always set in

Author: Roman Payne
Quote: With the need for the self in the time of another / I left my seaport grim and dear / knowing good work could be made / in the state governed by both Hope and Despair.

Author: Robert M. Drake
Quote: With all honesty, somewhere between the hello and the dreams I saw you in I fell in love.

Author: Robert M. Drake
Quote: She wasn't broken. She was just bent, over the chance of being ignored by the one she loved.

Author: Edward Abbey,  Postcards from Ed: Dispatches and Salvos from an American Iconoclast
Quote: I am hopeful, though not full of hope, and the only reason I don't believe in happy endings is because I don't believe in endings.

Author: David Schwimmer
Quote: Being generous or doing things for others actually makes me feel good so I don't do it because I hope karma will come round and get me and I'll benefit from it.

Author: Dave Matthes,  Bar Nights
Quote: ...you're either gonna spend your life fucking pussy, or taking it to church.

Author: Patrick Ness,  The Knife of Never Letting Go
Quote: I think how hope may be the thing that pulls you forward, may be the thing that keeps you going, but that it's dangerous, too, that it's painful and risky, that it's making a dare to the world and when has the world ever let us win a dare?

Author: James T. McCay
Quote: Tomorrow, you promise yourself, things will be different, yet, tomorrow is too often a repetition of today. And you disappoint yourself again and again.

Author: George Iles
Quote: Hope is faith holding out its hand in the dark.

Author: Eleanor Cameron,  The Court of Stone Children
Quote: And I sometimes think that a moment of touching is the difference between complete utter despair and the ability to carry on.

Author: John F. Kennedy
Quote: Children are the world's most valuable resource and its best hope for the future.

Author: David Levithan,  Dash & Lily's Book of Dares
Quote: I hope suffering don't exist.

Author: Karen Marie Moning,  The Alpha Alternative: JZB Sex Scene
Quote: I have found there to be little distance between the unlatching of a chain and the spreading of a woman’s legs. As if they can never unbar only a single entrance. It’s a disease called hope. Women suffer from it greatly.

Author: Daisaku Ikeda
Quote: A person, who no matter how desperate the situation, gives others hope, is a true leader.

Author: Goenawan Mohamad,  Pagi dan Hal-Hal yang Dipungut Kembali
Quote: I'm beginning to think that to hope isn't the same as to expect something. To hope is to believe that life is an acceptable chaos.

Author: Elie Wiesel,  Open Heart
Quote: Even in darkness it is possible to create light and encourage compassion. That it is possible to feel free inside a prison. That even in exile, friendship exists and can become an anchor. That one instant before dying, man is still immortal.

Author: Aberjhani,  Elemental: The Power of Illuminated Love
Quote: This world’s anguish is no different from the love we insist on holding back.

Author: Brian Brett
Quote: Farming is a profession of hope

Author: Jennifer Elisabeth
Quote: Everything hurts right now and nothing is helping because as the pain is getting worse — so is the love.

Author: Jennifer Elisabeth,  Born Ready: Unleash Your Inner Dream Girl
Quote: Does our purpose on Earth directly link to the people whom we end up meeting? Are our relationships and experiences actually the required dots that connect and then lead us to our ultimate destinies?

Author: Robert M. Drake
Quote: Maybe what this is. What we have, is something that will save us from ourselves.

Author: Kate DiCamillo,  The Tale of Despereaux
Quote: And hope is like love...a ridiculous, wonderful, powerful thing.

Author: J.M. Barrie,  Peter Pan in Kensington Gardens
Quote: The door', replied Maimie, 'will always, always be open, and mother will always be waiting at it for me.

Author: A.E. Housman
Quote: Now hollow fires burn out to black,And lights are fluttering low:Square your shoulders, lift your packAnd leave your friends and go.O never fear, lads, naught’s to dread,Look not left nor right: In all the endless road you treadThere’s nothing but the night.

Author: Jennifer Elisabeth,  Born Ready: Unleash Your Inner Dream Girl
Quote: I fantasize the night sky to be like a cosmic blue print of my life as I close my eyes and unbutton my heart…. just in case anyone up there is listening.

Author: Dave Pelzer,  A Child Called "It"
Quote: Mother can beat me all she wants, but I haven’t let her take away my will to somehow survive.

Author: Amy Lane,  Keeping Promise Rock
Quote: hope could betray you—but if you had no hope, life could actuallysurprise you in the best of ways.

Author: Naomi Benaron,  Running the Rift
Quote: Your hope is the most beautiful and the saddest in the world.

Author: Markus Zusak,  The Book Thief
Quote: ***A KEY WORD*** Imagined

Author: Roberto Bolaño,  2666
Quote: Even on the poorest streets people could be heard laughing. Some of these streets were completely dark, like black holes, and the laughter that came from who knows where was the only sign, the only beacon that kept residents and strangers from getting lost.

Author: Thomas Fuller
Quote: Great hopes make great men.

Author: Teri Garr
Quote: You can be diagnosed and treated early. And there is hope for the future.

Author: Debasish Mridha
Quote: The moon is the reflection of your heart and moonlight is the twinkle of your love.

Author: T.F. Hodge,  From Within I Rise: Spiritual Triumph Over Death and Conscious Encounters with "The Divine Presence"
Quote: A King and Queen cannot support a crown with eyes looking down. Their universe expands as far as you can see.

Author: G.I. Gurdjieff
Quote: Man must use what he has, not hope for what is not.

Author: Haruki Murakami,  1Q84
Quote: This is what it means to live on. When granted hope, a person uses it as fuel, as a guidepost to life. It is impossible to live without hope.

Author: Arthur Golden
Quote: For a flicker of a moment I imagined a world completely different from the one I'd always known, a world in which I was treated with fairness, even kindness-- a world in which fathers didn't sell their daughters.

Author: Neal A. Maxwell
Quote: There are certain mortal moments and minutes that matter. Certain hingepoints in the history of each human. Some seconds are so decisive they shrink the soul, while others are spent, so as to stretch the soul.

Author: Jane Yolen
Quote: Fiction cannot recite the numbing numbers, but it can be that witness, that memory. A storyteller can attempt to tell the human tale, can make a galaxy out of the chaos, can point to the fact that some people survived even as most people died. And can remind us that the swallows still sing around the smokestacks.

Author: Miguel Torga
Quote: May the sun come, it's a new day; In the pure land of fantasy; That our darkness enlightened

Author: Angie Smith,  Letting Go of Perfect: Women, Expectations, and Authenticity
Quote: But that's just it; I can either focus on what I have lost, or what I have gained, and I choose the latter.

Author: Thomas Love Peacock,  Gryll Grange
Quote: I like the immaterial world. I like to live among thoughts and images of the past and the possible, and even of the impossible, now and then.

Author: Rumi
Quote: If you are seeking, seek us with joyFor we live in the kingdom of joy.Do not give your heart to anything elseBut to the love of those who are clear joy,Do not stray into the neighborhood of despair.For there are hopes: they are real, they exist –Do not go in the direction of darkness –I tell you: suns exist.

Author: Will Brenner
Quote: Never Give up! Where theres life theres hope!...

Author: Jennifer Elisabeth
Quote: I’ve grown up defined by this desperate, undeniable, ‘can’t breathe’ kind of space inside of myself and I’m afraid that the diagnosis is fatal.

Author: Tammara Webber,  Between the Lines
Quote: I try to be rational and suppress the hope that this is for real, but hope has a way of closing its eyes to reason and it just keeps growing.

Author: Libba Bray,  A Great and Terrible Beauty
Quote: Might. Is there any opiate more powerful than that word?

Author: Anita Krishan
Quote: We are mosaics - pieces of light, love, history, stars -- glued together with magic and music and words.

Author: Ann-Marie MacDonald,  Fall on Your Knees
Quote: To believe and yet to have no hope is to thirst beside a fountain.

Author: J.R.R. Tolkien,  The Two Towers

Author: Ptahhotep
Quote: Be a craftsman in speech that thou mayest be strong, for the strength of one is the tongue, and speech is mightier than all fighting.

Author: Rosa DeLauro
Quote: President Kennedy understood the importance of equal pay for equal work and signed historic legislation that gave women around the country hope that one day their wages would be on par with that of their male counterparts.

Author: Terry Pratchett,  Going Postal
Quote: I wonder if it's like this for mountain climbers, he thought. You climb bigger and bigger mountains and you know that one day one of them is going to be just that bit too steep. But you go on doing it, because it’s so-o good when you breathe the air up there. And you know you'll die falling.

Author: Stephanie Skeem
Quote: Flowers don't tell, they show. That's the way good books should be too."--Stephanie Skeem. Author of Flotsam

Author: Holly Hood,  Prison of Paradise
Quote: Trust to some was placing all your insecurities and beliefs in one single person, and hoping he or she wouldn’t squash them.

Author: Lauren DeStefano,  Wither
Quote: Don't you miss it?"I say. "Being free."He laughs.

Author: Carol Oates,  Ember
Quote: Deep down under where his heart resided, strangled up in thorny vines of guilt, anger, fear and longing, there lay something deeper in him, something that he couldn’t see but she could.

Author: bell hooks,  Teaching Community: A Pedagogy of Hope
Quote: When we only name the problem, when we state complaint without a constructive focus or resolution, we take hope away. In this way critique can become merely an expression of profound cynicism, which then works to sustain dominator culture.

Author: Sharon Kay Penman,  When Christ and His Saints Slept

Author: Jennifer Elisabeth
Quote: I know that this process of ‘me changing my life’ doesn’t just end once I set fire to this list of things I hate about myself. Tonight isn’t as much of a new beginning as it is a violent end and I know the real work hasn’t even started yet.

Author: Jennifer Elisabeth,  Born Ready: Unleash Your Inner Dream Girl
Quote: I’m going to follow this invisible red thread until I find myself again… until I finally figure out… who I’m meant to be.

Author: Patricia St. John,  Patricia St. John Tells Her Own Story

Author: Leymah Gbowee,  Mighty Be Our Powers: How Sisterhood, Prayer, and Sex Changed a Nation at War

Author: Jonathan Goldstein,  Lenny Bruce is Dead
Quote: Everyone runs around trying to find a place where they still serve breakfast because eating breakfast, even if it's 5 o'clock in the afternoon, is a sign that the day has just begun and good things can still happen. Having lunch is like throwing in the towel.

Author: Jane Austen,  Emma
Quote: but a sanguine temper, though for ever expecting more good than occurs, does not always pay for its hopes by any proportionate depression. it soon flies over the present failure, and begins to hope again.

Author: Orison Swett Marden
Quote: There is no medicine like hope, no incentive so great, and no tonic so powerful as expectation of something tomorrow.

Author: Thomas Malory,  Le Morte d'Arthur
Quote: Yet some men say in many parts of England that King Arthur is not dead, but had by the will of our Lord Jesu into another place; and men say that he shall come again, and he shall win the holy cross.

Author: Adrian Peterson
Quote: It brings hope and peace of mind knowing that God gave His only begotten Son for us. I'm able to look back and know that on this day Jesus was born and gave us the opportunity to have eternal life.

Author: Michael Sims,  Apollo's Fire: A Day on Earth in Nature and Imagination
Quote: If there is nothing new under the sun, at least the sun itself is always new, always re-creating itself out of its own inexhaustible fire.

Author: E.M. Forster,  Maurice
Quote: There was something better in life than this rub­bish, if only he could get to it—love—nobility—big spaces where passion clasped peace, spaces no science could reach, but they existed for ever, full of woods some of them, and arched with majestic sky and a friend. . .

Author: Bree Despain,  The Dark Divine
Quote: What can you do how much can you give to bring grace and salvation unto even one soul

Author: Jarod Kintz,  99 Cents For Some Nonsense

Author: Lola Jaye,  By The Time You Read This

Author: Vera Nazarian,  The Perpetual Calendar of Inspiration

Maybe you are reminded of a great time when you hear it, or maybe it represents your life's dream.So, what is it? What is your favorite word of all words?Thought about it yet?Good.And now, think why.

Author: Dianne Sylvan,  Queen of Shadows

Author: Arthur Conan Doyle,  The Naval Treaty

Author: Meat Loaf,  Meat Loaf - Bat Out of Hell

Author: John Rucyahana,  The Bishop of Rwanda: Finding Forgiveness Amidst a Pile of Bones

Author: Robert M. Drake

Author: Tess Gerritsen,  The Silent Girl
Quote: With every year that I grow older, I also draw closer to (my loved ones) to the day when we will once again be together. So I march through the deepening shadows, serene and unafraid, because I know that at the end of my journey they will be waiting for me.

Author: Dean Koontz,  Winter Moon
Quote: Home was not a perfect place. But it was the only home they had and they could hope to make it better.

Author: Marian Wright Edelman
Quote: Failure is just another way to learn how to do something right.

Author: Edwidge Danticat,  Krik? Krak!

Author: Kelley Armstrong,  Dates From Hell

Author: Christopher Hitchens

Author: Debasish Mridha

Author: Aberjhani,  Journey through the Power of the Rainbow: Quotations from a Life Made Out of Poetry

Author: Thomas Moore

Author: Wallace Stegner,  Angle of Repose
Quote: Hope was always out ahead of fact, possibility obscured the outlines of reality.

Author: Wendell Berry

Author: Benjamin Wood,  The Bellwether Revivals

Author: Pope John Paul II

Author: Mary Beth Miller,  Aimee

Author: Robert M. Drake
Quote: We’re only instruments of love, flowing through heaps of pain hoping one day we’d hatch a passion of our own.

Author: Nusrat Sultana

Author: Dean Koontz,  Odd Thomas
Quote: You won't find the truth of life in morbidity, only in hope.

Author: Louis L'Amour,  Education of a Wandering Man
Quote: Books are precious things, but more than that, they are the strong backbone of civilization. They are the thread upon which it all hangs, and they can save us when all else is lost.

Author: Francis Gray

Author: Jeanne McElvaney,  Healing Insights: Effects of Abuse for Adults Abused as Children

Author: Janet Fitch,  White Oleander

Author: Alphonse Karr

Author: Amaka Imani Nkosazana

Author: Charity Parkerson,  The Society of Sinners
Quote: Hope is the most evil of all emotions

Author: L.M. Montgomery,  The Blue Castle
Quote: Despair is a free man--hope isa slave.

Author: Dean Koontz,  Dead and Alive

Author: Mollie Marti,  Walking with Justice: Uncommon Lessons from One of Life's Greatest Mentors

Author: Robert M. Drake

Author: Robert M. Drake
Quote: The greatest adventure is to have no fear for the blaze that lies ahead.

Author: Thomas Dutton

Author: Morgan Rhodes,  Rebel Spring
Quote: There was no hope in death, only an end.

Author: Richie Singh,  Chasing Butterflies

Author: Darrell Yarbrough
Quote: The Rest of Our Life Is Going To Be The Best of Our Life!

Author: Anonymous,  Holy Bible: King James Version
Quote: Believe on the Lord Jesus Christ and you will be saved.

Author: Jennifer Elisabeth
Quote: Something, somewhere, knows what’s best for me and promises to keep sending me people and experiences to light my way as long as I live in gratitude and keep paying attention to the signs.

Author: Norman Mailer,  The Big Empty: Dialogues on Politics, Sex, God, Boxing, Morality, Myth, Poker & Bad Conscience in America
Quote: Great hope has no real footing unless one is willing to face into the doom that may also be on the way.p.207

Author: George MacDonald,  A Hidden Life and Other Poems
Quote: But we believe – nay, Lord we only hope,That one day we shall thank thee perfectlyFor pain and hope and all that led or droveUs back into the bosom of thy love.

Author: J.R.R. Tolkien,  The Two Towers

Author: Aeschylus

Author: Gayla Reid,  All the Seas of the World
Quote: Old folks live on memory, young folk live on hope.

Author: Jennifer Elisabeth
Quote: Let this time in your life cut you open and drain all of the things that are holding you back. I’m going to help you forgive the things that you won’t let yourself forget.

Author: Bhagavid-Gita
Quote: Even amongst fierce flames/ The golden lotus can be planted.

Author: Eliot Engel

Author: Debasish Mridha

Author: Simon Zingerman,  We All Need Heroes: Stories of the Brave and Foolish
Quote: Using your talent, hobby or profession in a way that makes you contribute with something good to this world is truly the way to go.

Author: Sanhita Baruah

Author: Keith Ablow,  Murder Suicide

Author: Michelle Horst
Quote: Hope is the heartbeat of the soul~

Author: Gene Wolfe,  Shadow & Claw
Quote: Hope is a psychological mechanism unaffected by external realities.

Author: Mark Twain,  A Connecticut Yankee in King Arthur's Court

Hope springs up, and cheerfulness along with it, and then he is in good shape to do something for himself, if anything can be done.

Author: Brock Clarke,  An Arsonist's Guide to Writers' Homes in New England
Quote: Oh no,"I said, because if our life is just one endless song about hope and regret, then "oh no"is apparently that song's chorus, the words we always return to.

Author: Rainer Werner Fassbinder

Usually women are always reacting, doing what women are supposed to do, but in Sirk they think. It’s something that has to be seen. It’s great to see women think. It gives one hope. Honestly.

Author: Radclyffe Hall,  The Well of Loneliness
Quote: Do try to remember this: even the world's not so black as it is painted"-Valerie to Stephen (pg. 408)

Author: C. Moorer,  From Failure to Promise: An Uncommon Path to Professoriate
Quote: One often has to do what they have to do in order to do what they want to do; however if you only do what you want to do then you will never do what you have to do!

Author: Jennifer Elisabeth
Quote: I just want your voice aimed at me again. I want to absorb the direction of your eyes…

Author: John F. Kennedy

If a free society cannot help the many who are poor, it cannot save the few who are rich.

Author: Criss Jami,  Salomé: In Every Inch In Every Mile
Quote: I would rather my descendants have greater abilities and a greater knowledge of the love of Christ than I do, much like standing on one's shoulders in order to get a clearer view of the valley.

Author: Michelle Horst,  Visions and Shadows
Quote: ~ Faith lightens the path your shadowed mind has to walk ~

Author: Ricky Maye,  An Emerging Spirituality
Quote: Grace will follow us even when we are going the wrong way

Author: J.R.R. Tolkien,  The Two Towers
Quote: I have spoken words of hope. But only of hope. Hope is not victory.

Author: Samuel Smiles

Author: Jennifer Elisabeth
Quote: Your personal truth is your gift to the world.

Author: Rachel Cohn,  Dash & Lily's Book of Dares
Quote: All this hoping for nothing-or someone-that's maybe hopeless

Author: L.M. Fields
Quote: It doesn't matter where you've been, only where you are going.

Author: Deborah Day,  BE HAPPY NOW!
Quote: Every goal first started as something in our mind. You have it all within you!

Author: Ann Hood

Author: Benny Bellamacina
Quote: Love will never let you down, if you don't give it up

Author: Sophocles,  Antigone
Quote: Sister - if all this is true, what could I do or undo?

Author: Cate Tiernan,  Immortal Beloved

Author: Steve Goodier
Quote: Here is little habit that can make a big difference. Send sunbeams. Intentionally send a word of encouragement or appreciation every day to one person.

Author: Rachel Simon,  The Story of Beautiful Girl
Quote: There are two kinds of hope: the kind you couldn't do anything about and the kind you could. And even if the kind you could do something about wasn't what you'd originally wanted, it was still worth doing. A rainy day is better than no day. A small happiness can make a big sadness less sad.

Author: Nina LaCour,  Everything Leads to You
Quote: There are still Ava Maddoxes to find and sets to create and girls to kiss and colleges to attend. It's possible that someday I will hear a patsy Cline song and the heartbreak will barely register. It will be some distant, buried feeling. I won't remember how much it once hurt.

Author: Mollie Marti
Quote: Each life experience poses this question: how do you want to be changed because of me?

Author: Robert M. Drake
Quote: Excuse me, I feel interrupted and I think I've overdose from the idea of loving you.

Author: Santosh Kalwar
Quote: There is no hope for the hopeless but there is always some love for the loveless.

Author: Christian Bovee
Quote: When all else is lost, the future still remains.

Author: Betty Smith,  A Tree Grows in Brooklyn

Author: Jennifer Gardner Trulson,  Where You Left Me
Quote: We may be helpless to stop bad things from happening, but perhaps God leaves us signs and road maps to help us recover and reconnect, provided we know where to look.

Author: Robert M. Drake
Quote: To love is to soar in the wild unexpectedly.

Author: Sharon Kay Penman,  When Christ and His Saints Slept

Author: Helen Simonson,  Major Pettigrew's Last Stand

Author: Zack Wamp
Quote: One of the greatest men to ever walk this land was Dr. Martin Luther King, Jr. His life exemplified unity by bringing people together for the good of all. In any small way I hope to someday bring people together like Dr. King.

Author: Debasish Mridha
Quote: The secret of happiness is love and secret of love is nonjudgmental care.

Author: Debasish Mridha
Quote: Share your love, share you happiness, care for others; your wealth will be endless.

Author: Debasish Mridha
Quote: A friend is a friend who continues to love you and like you when you don't love him or like him any more.

Author: Simon Zingerman,  We All Need Heroes: Stories of the Brave and Foolish
Quote: That is why enemies can be great motivators. They serve as fuel for your fire.

Author: Stacey T. Hunt,  Most Wanted
Quote: Even if things aren't going the way we want right now, we will always get through it.

Author: Alexandre Dumas,  The Count of Monte Cristo

Author: Dana Reeve

Author: Robert Masello,  Blood and Ice
Quote: Regardless of how black the page, he had always managed to turn it and move on to a new chapter in his life.

Author: Vera Nazarian,  The Perpetual Calendar of Inspiration

Author: Gerard Manley Hopkins,  Poems by Gerard Manley Hopkins

Author: Lailah Gifty Akita

Author: Priscilla Warner,  The Faith Club: A Muslim, A Christian, A Jew--Three Women Search for Understanding
